awd_titl_txt: RUI:  Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Studies of Glasses
awd_abstract_narration: This research program involves the study of glasses, primarily                  through the use of nuclear magnetic resonance.  The proposed                    research is in several different areas.  One area is a                          collaboration (S.W. Martin, Iowa State) on 29Si magic angle                     sample spinning NMR on alkali borosilicate glasses over an                      extremely wide range of compositions.  A second area is an                      continuation of studies with P. Bray (Brown) on the 10B and 11B                 nuclear quadrupole resonance properties of alkali borate glasses.               Further studies will also be made of extremely high alkali                      content alkali borate glasses with the emphasis on exploring the                relationship between structure and physical properties.  A new                  collaboration with Kamitsos (National Hellenic Research                         Foundation, Athens) on joint infrared and Raman spectroscopic                   studies of very high alkali contnet borate glasses will be                      initiated.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
